channel.title: Web Development on DigitalCash.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Web Development on DigitalCash.dev

item.title: RPC Web Proxy & Explorer 2024-Q3
item.author: aj@therootcompany.com (AJ ONeal)
item.description: Dash, on The Web. https://rpc.digitalcash.dev (mainnet) https://trpc.digitalcash.dev (testnet) (RPC Web Proxy and RPC Explorer for integrators) Why These are the services that I wish I had had access to years ago. It would have saved me 10s of hours to have all the tools and documentation available together directly on the web, immediately - also getting a jumpstart on coding without waiting for hours of syncing. This proposal serves 2 functions:

item.title: RPC Web Proxy & Explorer: Installation
item.author: aj@therootcompany.com (AJ ONeal)
item.description: System Requirements 1vCPU 32MB RAM 16MB Storage (MB, not GB) Install dashd: curl https://webi.sh/dashd | sh source ~/.config/envman/PATH.env Wait for a full sync Update dash.conf as needed, and restart: [main] rpcuser=dash-rpcproxy rpcpassword=CHANGE_ME rpcbind=0.0.0.0:9998 rpcallowip=0.0.0.0/0 [test] rpcuser=dash-rpcproxy rpcpassword=CHANGE_ME rpcbind=0.0.0.0:19998 rpcallowip=0.0.0.0/0 Install dash-rpcproxy See https://github.com/digitalcashdev/rpcproxy and https://github.com/digitalcashdev/rpcproxy/issues/3 Update config file and workdir mkdir -p ~/srv/dash-rpcproxy/ mkdir -p ~/.config/dash-rpcproxy/ touch ~/.config/dash-rpcproxy/env export DASHD_RPC_USERNAME=dash-rpcproxy export DASHD_RPC_PASSWORD=CHANGE_ME export DASHD_RPC_HOSTNAME=localhost export DASHD_RPC_PORT=19998
